Exploration Highlights

Gold:
- Tambourah Gold Project:
- RC drilling extended gold mineralization over 200m strike, including:
- 3m @ 2.99g/t Au from 36m (TBRC25013)
- 2m @ 3.68g/t Au from 47m (TBRC25013)
- 5m @ 1.46g/t Au from 100m (TBRC25003)
- Drilling ongoing at Alexandria/Young Australian prospects (assay results pending).

  • Beatty Park Sth (Bryah):

  • 26-hole aircore program (1,069m) completed; assays pending. Historic high-grade intercepts include 5m @ 22.9g/t Au.

  • Tambina Gold Project:

  • Surface sampling returned up to 4.3g/t Au (four samples >1g/t Au).

Critical Minerals:
- Speewah Nth (Antimony-Silver):
- Rock samples yielded high grades: 4.54% Sb, 517ppm Ag, 3.62% Cu.

Corporate & Capital Raisings

  • Placement (3 June 2025): Raised $0.58M via 29M shares.

Financials (Appendix 5B)

  • Cash Balance (30 June 2025): $1.90M
  • Quarterly Exploration Spend: $248K
  • Funding Runway: ~4.1 quarters at current burn rate.

Other Material Updates

  • Julimar Nth: SQM terminated earn-in agreement; Tambourah retains 100% ownership.
  • CEO Appointment: Terry Topping appointed (500K shares issued under ESIP).

No material operational disruptions or further financing risks disclosed.

5. Key Risks/Uncertainties

  2. Developing fluorine waste recycling technology to produce industrial chemicals (hydrogen fluoride and aluminium fluoride) from aluminium smelter waste.

Material Information Summary

  • Hyperaccumulator Confirmation: Sesuvium portulacastrum seaweed confirmed as a hyperaccumulator of gold (up to 81.32 mg/kg dry biomass), silver, copper, and lithium.
  • Polluted Water Enhancement: Metal uptake significantly higher in polluted/brackish water vs. clean marine environments.
  • Extraction Challenge: Conventional chemical extraction methods failed due to multi-metal interference; focus shifts to biological (microbial) techniques.
  • Next Phase: Six-month R&D program under negotiation with TPIH to develop selective microbial extraction processes.
  • Scalability: Species’ adaptability supports potential deployment in diverse coastal regions (e.g., Indonesian archipelago).
